caption: The food was great! Order the potato salad!
Food was excellent Japanese cuisine was served promptly and the waiter was super nice

Food is always good and innovative at ZIGU.  We went for a lunch.  Temperature check at the check in, distancing and disinfecting are the things nowadays.  It depends on the staff how strict they want to ensure the safety of themselves and others.  I didn’t get temp checked while others got tested.  The tables were not effectively cleaned after the other guests.  The few squirts of disinfectant spray went over to the one table but 2 other tables weren’t throughly cleaned.  And it took few seconds for the server to clean the table.  We would feel much better watching if it was cleaned better. (It shows how our table was cleaned..)  I would give better star rating but I am hoping to get the attention so they would pay more attention to how important to protect everyone including their own staff.  Food was great otherwise.

We ate at Zigu on Saturday night and i'm pretty sure i've recommended it to like 10 people already . First of all, their safety protocols are 10 / 10. They thermometer check you and sanitize your hands upon entry (more than our hotel did!) before escorting you to your table where once seated you can remove your masks. We had a 730pm reservation which is pushing it with a 1.5 year old and a 5 year old who have been at the beach all day , however as soon as they saw that we had kids, they were quick to take our orders and get the kids food out which i appreciate sooo much! Everything we ordered was divine and the portions were really good size. Wait staff was on it and the atmosphere reminds me of europe or like a cute stylish cafe in Bali which we don't have a lot of here in Hawaii. 100 percent will be back!

Looks can be deceiving when driving by this restaurant. Hubby and I decided to dine at Zigu based on reviews and was stunned on how big the restaurant is! Our meal was absolutely amazing and had great service.  I recommend getting the potato salad, mushroom tempura, and tuna cutlet.  Food came out quick as wellp!  We will definitely be back!
Best Ahi Collar, Super Aloha Staff
David was our waiter, wonderful service and excellent food. Will definitely be back

Zigu has been a savior during this quarantine. Their lunch specials are delicious and their fish is so fresh. Pictured below is my go to order which is their salmon poke bowl lunch special. $12 for fresh chunks of salmon with tobiko, tempura flakes, green onions and seaweed over a well seasoned bed of sushi rice. Their miso soup is made with actual kombu and bonito which you can taste. I also love ordering their sushi rolls and am looking forward to trying some of their beef dishes. Their hours aren't currently reflected in Google, they are open much earlier than is shown. Please support this local restaurant if you can and tip them generously as they are staying open for us while many restaurants had to close. Thank you Zigu!

Zigu is fantastic. The atmosphere is really nice; the restaurant is located in the heart of Waikiki inside of a quaint little building with indoor and outdoor seating. The outdoor dining area is in a beautiful courtyard. The dishes feature local, farm-to-table ingredients and are a perfect blend of authentic Japanese tradition and sophisticated fusion. The drink menu is also great with an impressive selection of sake and wine.
(Translated by Google) Delicious but expensive The place was in a convenient place and outside seating so it was good not cold  (Original) 美味しいけど高い 場所は便利な所にあり外のお席だったので寒くなく良かった

This was a nice little place near our vacation rental.  They had someone stand outside and invite us in to enjoy happy hour.  We went and had our dinner there.  The restaurant is very trendy and we appreciated the "farm to table" freshness, but the flavors were a little bland and needed more.  It was the usual cost expected of a Waikiki eatery - even though we had a coupon from the "Best of Oahu" book.  We were 2 adults and 2 kids, and with the coupon it was $85 (but we were still hungry).  We were seated near the door where people smoked so that also contributed to making the meal less enjoyable.  We didn't like the food enough to go back but it wasn't bad - I wish I could give it 3.5 stars.

Oh my Lord!! Sooo yum. A hidden gem off the busy streets of Hawaii, away from the big chains and the duke et al. Loved every dish especially the miso salmon and fried chicken. Our waiter Corey was amazing too. Will be dreaming of this meal for a long time!

If Japan and Hawai'i had a baby they'd name it Zigu. Relaxed and hip atmosphere. Staff are very friendly. Ingredients locally sourced and the food is GOOD. I live around the corner and I have to stop myself from eating here all the time. Love this place.

Sophisticated Japanese Izakaya (small plates) food inspired by local Hawaiian ingredients. Great drink list. Ginger beer! 🍅 beer! Amazing food. Start with the burdock or the pickled onion to cleanse your palate. Add on great appetizers including many vegan dishes. End with satisfying fish or meat creations. Sake selection equally impressive. Relaxed service in front of a hectic yet well choreographed open kitchen. Hip servers. My new favorite in Waikiki...
Very good food! Love it! I will go back! Service is great!

Ate here on Christmas Day for dinner. Good food, somewhat reasonable prices, friendly and attentive staff. The place has a distinct atmosphere: it's small, casual and just slightly run down, giving it a charming "hole-in-the-wall" feel.

First thing first- I absolutely love the warm and inviting atmosphere and tones of this restaurant. For the food, though I’m most definitely not a fish fanatic, was fresh and absolutely flavorful. Our waiter was extremely friendly and helpful in giving recs; I especially enjoyed the handmade kale udon, topped with dried kale and paired with peanut sauce. All in all, loved the food, service, portions, and atmosphere!

Everything freshly fried is delicious. The female staff at the entrance is very friendly. Special event tonight but I still love this place. Located in Waikiki off the beaten path on Seaside.  I love the Abalone here. It’s so fresh and it has just the right crunch. They have Hamachi Kama but this does run out quite often, so check with the server first.  Sushi bar is also great, you can sit at the bar or order from the table. Decent Sake list as well but they have a full bar to your liking.
(Translated by Google) For Hawaii, it was good to have a conscientious price and not too much.  (Original) ハワイにしては、良心的な価格で美味しく量も多すぎずよかったです。

Worst sushi I ever had shrimp was not tempura and way too much rice.  The manager was rude and not welcoming.  Had I tried the sushi before I left I would have left it there. I way over tipped too.

(Translated by Google) Creative Japanese cuisine using Hawaiian ingredients. You can enjoy Hawaii, such as fried eggs made with local eggs and tempura of palm buds, but Japanese food. Try out the potato shochu and Nanka that are made in Haleiwa! The raw Hawaiian candy, which is a raw material, varies depending on the timing of preparation, so you can enjoy a slightly different taste depending on the season.  (Original) ハワイ産の食材を使った創作和食。地元の卵で作った卵焼きや、ヤシの芽のテンプラなど、和食だけどハワイが楽しめます。 ハレイワで作っている芋焼酎、浪花もぜひお試しあれ！原料のハワイ産の芋は仕込みののタイミングによって異なるので、時期によってほのかに異なる味わいを楽しめます。
A hip fusion Japanese restaurant. The dishes are quite innovative and tasty.
Great food,very friendly Japanese hosts. Very attentive. Drink variety is specialized. I liked the Watermelon Sake Mojito.
I have been in Hawaii for the past week and have been eating out daily - Zigu was the best so far. Great food and cocktails . Sashimi and sushi was amazing . Thanks

Very innovative Hawaiian-inspired seasonal Japanese food! The service was friendly and the atmosphere was comfortable. Had the watercress and tofu salad, macademian nuts and sauteed burdock, bonito sashimi with Hawaiian onion, the tuna poke roll, and the pork-belly udon. The bonito sashimi was awesome, the pork-belly udon was under-whelming, the rest were very good. It was a good experience and I'd recommend it.

A casual fancy food restaurant in Waikiki. 🥬: Lots of interesting veggie options like kale beer and kale udon. 🌐: Locally sourced foods that are crazy fresh. 🖌️: Modern feel with a clearly thought-out style. 🎌: Japanese inspired dishes that are delicious. Lots of fish, sake, and shochu!
I loved the maui onion and sliced avocado salad.

I am not sure this restaurant has reached its full potential, but appears to be on a good trajectory.  The dining area has ambience with courtyard like seating as well as bar seating inside.  Service was alittle uneven because different staff dropped by but I did not really have anyone taking care of me.  I had the pork dish which was good as was the price reasonable, but it did not fall in the fine dining category.  The dish was infused with honey but the overall taste was not very nuanced - it tasted like a barbecue rib with some added sugar.  However, Waikiki is somewhat of a food desert and this is a welcomed addition.

Excellent food and nice staff that helped me making the right choice for the dinner. I would just improve the welcome-in, had to wait too much compared to the amount of people sitting in the restaurant.

I've got 5% battery on my phone, but still had to comment...this was the worst service (almost ever in my life), first person waited 30 min from main party to eat then last person waited 1 hr to get food out and was over-charged on 2 items. Also, the soba was not much better than instant and pork belly was likely pork butt.:( Was expecting way better (in the words of my cousin: "food was sh*ty, service was worse").
Pacifica gastronomy!  It was a delicious journey.
(Translated by Google) It is delicious Japanese food.  (Original) 美味しい日本料理です。
They have a few great items on the menu for lunch. Quality over quantity. My chirashi bowl and pork miso were fantastic. A+.

Waikiki is very tourist heavy so sometimes it can be hard to find food that is genuine and made with love. So glad I found this place during my visit. Interesting and delicious food. We had a table of three and ordered 6 or 7 items to share. Service was top notch and the food was some of the best I've had anywhere. The tuna cheek was absolutely incredible, I can't stop thinking about it. Such a great dish. I have never seen it on a menu anywhere else and all three of us were blown away by how delicious it was. I am so glad we stopped in and please give my kuddos to the chef, just awesome food. This place is damn good, and if you don't enjoy a meal here while visiting the area, you are missing out on a very memorable experience. Also ask about the restaurant upstairs called Paris Hawaii--I went there the next day and was equally impressed. Whoever runs this place knows what they are doing. Great job!

Deducting one star for disengaged service. Probably we went in right before the lunch break for them, but still, not a good excuse to not providing the service at this caliber. Overall, we felt rushed and I didn't finish most of my foods.  In terms of the foods, I liked the kale noodle with pickle, okra, nadou and seaweed. It's a refreshing dish after eating several days of heavier meals. Chirashi is good for it's presentation, but nothing too out of ordinary from my experience.

In October 2018, we enjoyed a 4+ stars Zigu dining experience for creative, fresh, local farm to table meal with excellent service, thank you. Last night we had a 2+ stars experience - we were not in hurry but very poor communication and coordination between our friendly server and kitchen + sushi chef became frustrating. Want to love this place but we will not be in a hurry to dine here again.

(Translated by Google) [ZIGU ... Japanese cuisine with ingredients grown in the blessed climate and ocean of Hawaii ...]  This last night of the Honolulu Triathlon smile road team ... at ZIGU  We talked about our dreams with our employees with delicious food and alcohol.  ZIGU ... the taste of stability !! Moth  Commitment to Hawaii's fresh ingredients Cook with the techniques of Japanese cuisine Japan quality island Japanese  The word "ZIGU", the name of the store, is derived from the concept of the store, "EAT LOCAL" (for local consumption for local consumption), replaced with the sound of the ground (ZI) (GU), with the sound of the sum is.  Taste the ingredients of Hawaii to your heart's content Japanese Restaurant & Bar like never before  It is said that the Japanese food made by respecting the land and people in Hawaii and using the ingredients of Hawaii as much as possible is called "island Japanese".  A shop that offers Japanese food that was not available in Hawaii until now, which can only be done by ZIGU with the “certain Japanese food technology” that takes broth, takes time and effort and utilizes the original taste of the ingredients.  ZIGU ... It was delicious !! Moth  (Original) 【ZIGU…ハワイの恵まれた風土と海で育まれた食材で日本の料理を…】  今回のホノルルトライアスロン笑顔道チーム最後の晩餐は…ZIGUにて  美味しい料理とお酒で社員達と夢を語り盛り上がりました。  ZIGU…安定の美味しさ‼︎  ハワイの新鮮な食材にこだわり 日本料理の技法で調理する ジャパンクオリティーのアイランドジャパニーズ  店名である「ZIGU」の言葉の由来は、店のコンセプトである「EAT LOCAL」（地産地消）を、「地（ZI）を喰らう（GU）」と、和の音に置き換えたものだそうです。  ハワイの食材を心ゆくまで味わえる 今までにない和食レストラン＆バー  ハワイの土地や人々にリスペクトをし、可能な限りハワイの食材を用いて作る和食のことを、"アイランドジャパニーズ"と呼ぶそうです。  出汁をとり、手間をかけ、食材本来の味を生かすという「確かな和食の技術」で、ZIGUにしかできない、今までのハワイにはなかった和食をご提供するお店  ZIGU…美味しかったです‼︎
Happy hour until 6 pm
(Translated by Google) Courteous but the food did not meet my taste  (Original) Cortesi ma il cibo non ha incontrato il mio gusto

The service was awful. We sat down and ordered within 10 min of arriving and only until an hour later did our waiter tell us that they were just getting started on our sushi roll after having to be reminded. The waitress was managing 8 tables at once an over burden of tables in the heart of Honolulu on a packed weekend night.  The owner of this establishment has no sense of wait staff requirements; nor does their seem to be a system to be an electronic management system in place to assist with the large requirements put on their wait staff.  Food was sub par. The tuna roll was the only satisfying item.  I wouldn’t recommend the experience.

Slowww!! That describes the speed of service at ZIGU. Came here on a busy night and they couldn't get our orders right.  Food is alright but unless the kitchen works out their kinks, a 2+ hour meal service is expected. Wrong entrees and skipped orders were the norm. Food also seems to arrive in random order rather than at once. Waited 30 mins between entrees.
(Translated by Google) The staff also felt good. Relatively, it was the seasoning that Japanese had.  (Original) スタッフも感じ良かったです。比較的、日本人にあった味付けでした。

Great Japanese food at a reasonable price for lunch. We had the Chirashi ($18), the sukiyaki style beef ($16),  and Cold Kale Udon with Fried Kale ($9.50) with tsuyu sauce. The Chirashi was very good and had a ton of different items besides fish to add to the texture and flavor. There were mushrooms, sweet potato, kale, and shredded carrots. Added to the overall experience without being too much. The sukiyaki beef had really good flavor, but the beef we had a bit stringy and tough. It came with a raw egg to dip the meat in and that was fantastic. The kale udon was really good as well. Noodles were bright green and chewy. The tsuyu dipping sauce was savory but the wasabi that came with it did not really have any kick to it. Pork miso soup that came with all the set lunches was amazing. One of the best miso soups I've had. It was chock full of pork and fried tofu bits.  They validate parking at the Hyatt Centric Waikiki Beach for 2 hours.
(Translated by Google) This bar is open until late in the Waikiki area. Is there any customer service? It is a level.  (Original) ワイキキエリアで遅くまで営業しているバーです。接客もそこそこ？レベルです。

This place is excellent and underrated. Must try!
Excellent food! Great atmosphere and nice staff. All stars. So good that we already booked a table to came back and try everything else we can from the menu!
I have been here only twice and only for a last minute drink, shochu and whiskey ball both solid
One of the best sushi experiences I had in North America and I lived here for 17 years. Not a lot of variety of options, but the ones they do have are spectacular.
One of my favorite restaurants in Waikiki. Great and friendly staff - especially Brandon - and great food & drinks!
Great spot to enjoy healthy udon in a historical building of Waikiki.

Nagi and buckwheat noodles, tempura was very tasty. I will come and visit by all means. I stumbled upon Zigu when looking for another location but when seeing that it was Japanese-fushion had to go in. The food was amazing; typical of Hawai'i they use a lot of local produce but had a heavy Japanese influence. The drinks were delicious and it was all reasonably priced. I would highly recommend a visit, it is possibly the best Japanese food outside Japan and ask to sit at the bar and watch the chefs at work!

Small little place.  Great food and great service... glad we tried the place.

(Translated by Google) A really great meal at fair prices. The restaurant is modern with nice bar and shushibar. The tuna cheek was sensationally good with the teriyaki sauce. The meat has fallen from the cheekbone, really a dream. Pasta and sushi were also very good. Waiters were very attentive and fast. Sake was also delicious. Nudeln und Sushi waren auch sehr gut. Kellner waren sehr aufmerksam und schnell. Sake war auch lecker. Ein sehr gelungenes Konzept in waikikis Seitenstraße „Seaside ave“ Definitiv zu empfehlen

Fantastic local produce fusion Japanese food. Excellent service. So good we came back again even though we only have a few nights in Waikiki.

I have been to thousands of restaurants in my life and that has to be top 5. Food is magnificent. Decor is a very well balanced combination of New York style brasseries and Japanese traditional eaterie. The bar seating area is gorgeous and cosy. The vibe is relaxed. Complete understated luxury type place. Absolutely loved it

Service was subpar. The menu looked great with a lot of options, but no server ever explained it to us. The food we ordered was great! But we waited a long time for each small dish.
Great atmosphere

Staying at Island Colony we walked by Zigu and the vibe was so cozy we decided to go for dinner. The cocktails and food were really good and the menu had details on where the local ingredients where sourced from. All the staff were lovely and we would definitely go back.
What a nice place to have dinner!  Wow!  I love this place.  Could get crowded but very friendly staff and great food.
Delicious Japanese themed restaurant utilizing local ingredients. Lively and fun atmosphere! Would highly recommend!

This Japanese restaurant is very original, it’s a Japanese authenthic with a fusion of western culinary art. Great sushi and drinks. The portions were small so I recommend if you are a big eater you order two items. I’m not a big guy at 5”5 and slim and I had a roll and shashimi to include appetizer and left the place satisfied. Great little Japanese place. I recommend for a cool dinner evening with friends. I do not recommend if you do not like Asian food because there is no plain rice or other stuff like that. Everything is well prepared.

Zigu is located at Seaside Avenue right next to Tapas Restaurant and Lanai Bar. It's a restaurant that I have driven by many times and never noticed a restaurant was located there. The interior has an all wood motif almost like an old sake distillery. My girlfriend and I were situated across from the kitchen, against the wall. We were granted a quick service by David--in and out within 50 minutes.  The parking is at Hyatt Centric Hotel, located at 349 Seaside Ave, Honolulu, HI 96815. It is situated half a block from Zigu--at a corner of Seaside Avenue and Kuhio Avenue. I highly suggest using a gps or Google Maps to the parking structure instead of to the restaurant because Waikiki is infested with one way streets. Zigu validate Hyatt's parking ticket if your restaurant bill is $30 or more.  Zigu's menu is not the most user friendly. It looks like a photo album without actual photos. I had to rely on social media pictures of their offerings to make informed choices. The restaurant provides free WiFi with its password discretely printed into the interior back cover of the menu. After looking at the menu, I can tell that it was well thought out, as well as each dish's components. Each item I ordered was interesting enough to merit a description. The following items were what we ordered:  Potato Salad Poke Sushi Fried Shrimp Rib Eye Ten Rice  The Apple Wood Smoked Local Egg Potato Salad with crispy potato sticks was a simple looking dish with a memorable flavor. The eggs were those 1 minute soft boiled / smoked egg with its yoke runny. The potato with its sauce was creamy and it helped dampen the saltines (smoky) taste from the egg. The potato chips was just another texture to the dish. I appreciate the portioning of the egg otherwise the dish would have been too salty and overbearing.  The Local Tuna & Kona Amberjack Poke Sushi with sea asparagus, seaweed, yuzu pepper should have been the very first item that was served instead of the smokey potato salad. The sea asparagus and seaweed were too small of garnishes to impact each slider's taste. The yuzu pepper was absent from the dish--that is after zooming into the picture I took of the dish. It was an almost amuse bouche since we were not amused.  The Deep Fried Kauai Shrimp with wasabi-basil aioli sauce was something out of Panda Express' menu--honey walnut shrimp. The difference is that there were 4 lightly battered jumbo (U10 size) shrimp and the creamy sauce had small green tobiko mixed into it instead of walnuts. Overall, the sauce tasted of wasabi. It did not taste of basil, especially while chewing on the basil garnishes. I appreciated that the head was fried crispy.  The Ten Grain Rice was chewy and had a neutral flavor. I used it as a palate cleanser between dishes. I just wish the rice was steaming when it reached my table.  The Diced Rib Eye Steak with grated local white radish & ponzu sauce came as a sizzling platter that errupted oily teriyaki smoke throughout the room and onto my clothes. The steak, surprisingly, was soft--its texture can rival the rib eye from Ruth's Chris. However, there was no actual seasoning, I tasted, on the steak as it was cooked. The sauce was not thick enough and there was not enough ponzu juice. The sauce was forgettable. I did not care for the radish as its texture was not crunchy because it was grated too finely and its taste was off putting. I could not exactly described why, but I did not find any contributing use by the radish.  Although each dish had slight short comings, I will be back and hungry for more.

Quick note that their lunch menu is quite limited compared to all the photos you see posted here. That said, we tried their teriyaki beef lunch set and their daily Bento box. As you can see from the photos, there's a broad selection of micro-dishes included, each with flavours delicately balanced. We loved the non-alcoholic mint/ginger/lemon cocktail which was very refreshing!  Staff are really friendly here. Would love to come back to try their dinner selections. 4.5⭐

The sake selection is small, but very quality. The kale udon is handmade everyday by blending kale into the mixture, and the text is absolutely perfect - just the right amount of chewiness. Overall, a very good experience with quality, price, and service
Great Japonese restaurant! Loved it. Also great selection of beers with $3 specials on Honolulu beerworks beers

So much care and thought are put in to the food at this establishment. They even serve Mamaki (valuable Hawaii tea) instead of just standard ice water.  Outdoor ambience in the day is great, I'm excited to go there for dinner. Prices are reasonable and parking is validated across the street at Hyatt Centric.

It is great place、 but make foods too fancy and expensive.

Awesome Japanese fusion restaurant! Anything I've had on the menu so far has been amazing.  Can't wait to go back again.  The atmosphere in this restaurant really reminds me of being in Japan.  I speak Japanese and used it to order, there are many Japanese tourists here eating as well and it is a very in crowd.  The drinks here are also superb! I hope you get to enjoy a small walk into Japan while in this spot like how I felt. ごちそうさまでした。

Because the menu was plentiful, I would like to come back to Hawaii again.  Staff T - shirt of hilife, I want you to be cute. Way better food than Morimoto Asia in Waikiki. Family loved the food and great Happy Hour drinks.

Excellent food!  Delicious and unique taste and presentation.  A once in lifetime experience.  Very reasonably priced too!  Great bar experience.  Love the friendliness

Family style, Hawiian sourced, Japanese inspired food. Simple & amazing! We had 6 people and ate lavishly. The maui onion, ahi seared, beef, a red fish sashimi, wasabi shrimp, oysters and loved it! Outstanding flavor. Couldn't belive it. Top notch place and it was very busy and price was very reasonable for Waikiki.  Parking is horrid. Try the centric hotel garage at Kuhio and seaside or vallet there. They will validate. Little loud. Has indoor and outdoor seating. Great sake menu!
Extremely disappointed with the service, it was nice overall but our waitress was having an off day. Not sure why, heard great things about this place in the past.
Creative menu and pairing of ingredients - and a lovely presentation of the dishes. Sat at the bar where you can watch the chefs at work, nice!
(Translated by Google) It is a restaurant where you can enjoy Japanese food that Japanese people can communicate.  (Original) 日本語が通じる日本食も楽しめるレストランです。

I'm sure that we order a "drink" rather "water", it's ok to add some water into wine to save budget, but try to not add WHOLE CUP OF WATER. You know what, it tastes like a small cup of oolong tea with too much water and even NO shochu inside. （btw, the order is Oolong-high ￣^￣ Good place, good music, good decoration, but never come back twice, thanks for your service

This place is one of the best Japanese places I have ever eaten at. The menu is best shared with several others as there is so much to choose from. Make sure to get the spicy Salmon sushi, as well as the potato salad. They also played Jack Johnson the whole night while my family and I ate there. Five out of five, no doubt!
Great food!
Delicious food enjoyed in a cozy ambiance. Great place for a date, group dinner and even solo drinks at the bar!
Excellent food and cocktails along with a congenial staff. Highly recommended.

It did content the French and the mind that likes to travel with reminiscences and experiences from the tastebuds. Thank you to the knowleagable and kind servers who make me say, I 'll come back and launch a party there

Amazing food. Sat at the chef bar where you see the chefs work. Really appreciated their art being a chef myself. Good conversation with them as well answering questions I had. Will recommend this place to everyone and will be back for sure. Great work to thr chefs there!
Loved everything except the egg bread stuff. That smell literally is an exact replica of a cattle lot.

Japanese cooking served with Hawaiian ingredients. Everything was fresh and tasty. I enjoyed the unique coupling of ingredients that you don't come across in Japan, such as kale x udon (noodles). And my favorite is the poke sushi! Staffs were friendly. I am looking forward to go back there again!

If you crave creative small Japanese-inspired gourmet dishes in a stylish setting you’ll probably like it. I personally prefer my food less complicated and a simpler menu that isn’t trying so hard to impress. The owner’s several other restaurants in the area are also like that. Perfectly decent place just not my thing.
sushi and udon are very yummy, relatively expensive but worth it.
Pricey but good to bring a date to. Family style. You share what u order
Excellent Japanese fare.

Amazing food - we got sat on the sushi bar for our honeymoon dinner...the chef made the experience so special! He was informing us of the dishes he was making. The food was beyond deliscious. We will definitely be back to try more hopefully soon!
Love this place. The food is so fresh and delicious.
Great food and atmosphere!
(Translated by Google) It was a very delicious Japanese restaurant.  (Original) とても美味しい日本料理のお店でした。

Nice cozy place on the inside and a good sized outdoor space. Mostly japanese food with local ingredients and everything was pretty tasty. I would try the pork belly with mochi balls which was really good. Kale soba was interesting and the potato salad was the best I ever had. Granted I don't really eat potato salad so take that with a grain of salt. The sushi was cute looking, but not really special.  Make a reservation since they just opened.

This place is a great spot - indoors it feels a lot like a classic, cozy izakaya. Outdoors it's a little more spacious and you feel like you're in a nice Waikiki restaurant. Food does not disappoint, with creative spins on standard Japanese and local fusion fare. The price point is right at where it should be. Staff was excellent, coordinated and made great conversation. I'll be coming back here for sure.  Mark, Lisa - you guys made us feel right at home! - Adrian
Wonderful! Food and ambiance is on point

(Translated by Google) When I was wandering around looking for dinner, I found a Japanese menu on the table and went in. And the person who guided me to the seat was relieved to be able to speak Japanese. People who come to pick up orders can understand simple Japanese. The menu was like a creative Japanese food incorporating Hawaiian ingredients, and the presentation and taste were as delicious as eating in Japan. If you come to Hawaii next time, I definitely want to go there again. What I thought was the most amazing was that it seemed to incorporate Japanese "hospitality" into the customer service, and the service was much better than other Hawaiian stores.  (Original) 夜ご飯を探しブラブラしていた所、日本語メニューが表にあるのを発見し入ってみました。 そして、席に案内してくれた人も日本語が喋れて安心しました。オーダーを取りにくる人も簡単な日本語は通じました。メニューもハワイの食材を取り入れた創作和食的な感じで、盛り付けや味も普通に日本で食べるくらい美味しかったです。 次回ハワイに来ることがあれば、是非また行きたいお店。一番凄いと思ったのは、日本の「おもてなし」的な所を接客に取り入れているようで、他のハワイのお店よりサービスが凄く良かったです。

(Translated by Google) I happened to pass in front of the store when I stayed at a nearby hotel. It was a shop that attracted me from the outside, so I stopped by at night. The Japanese food was arranged with Hawaiian ingredients, and it looked and tasted great. The terrace seats are also nice.  (Original) 近くのホテルに宿泊した時に偶然店の前を通りました。 外観から興味を惹かれる店でしたので、夜に思わず立ち寄りました。 日本食をハワイ産の食材でアレンジしてあり、見た目も味も最高でした。 テラス席もいい感じです。

Wow! What an incredible dining experience..... as a solo diner, I was overwhelmed by the incredibly warm welcome. I felt as if I were joining a family for dinner. The chefs are not just talented, but they are culinary artists. I was very amazed at how each dish was lovingly prepared and presented with reverence.  Truly an amazing and memorable dining experience in the heart of Waikiki Beach!
Great place for a great Japanese metal! Make sure to try several smaller dishes instead of one large dish.

We came to eat at this Resturant and the server brought one out of the 3 orders. First, it did not mentioned in the menue there was a bacon in the potato with egg and apple sticks and we got another plate instead. The other 2 ordered did not come to our table which could be a mistake.  Our server left and we got switched to another one and he was nice. Not his fault that the order did not come in.  When we asked about our 2 left orders, he did not know also not his fault. He waived the $7 for 1 order because we had to go and did not want to wait any longer. Our issue is that the manager did not come and apologies for the inconvenience and the wait for nothing which he knew.  We got there at 10:05 and we left around 10:40pm.  Will not recommend the service!
Great place , very good atmosphere and food .
(Translated by Google) The service and taste were very good. The arrangement was beautiful and I enjoyed it with my eyes!  (Original) サービスもお味もとても良かった。盛り付けも美しく目で楽しめた！

(Translated by Google) The atmosphere of the shop and the staff were very nice, and the food was all delicious! The ingredients used were Hawaiian, so I was full of feelings. I decided to repeat it! I want to see how udon is made this time ♪  (Original) お店の雰囲気とスタッフの方々がとてもナイスで、お食事は全部美味しかったです!食材もハワイ産を使っていてこだわり感満載でした。リピ決定!今度はおうどん作ってるとこ見たいな〜♪
Stylish Japanese Izakaya Restaurant. The Japanese chef has a lot of culinary experience. Gotta try this place. They validate parking at Hyatt Centric.
